stem: Which of the following regimes is the recommended initial treatment for most adults with active tuberculosis?
disc:
There must be either a positive x-ray finding or a positive smear with one or more clear risk factors to diagnose pulmonary tuberculosis. 

Treatment is commenced with a 4 drug regime (RIPE) for a standard 6 months duration.
- Rifampicin
- Isoniazid
- Pyrazinamide (not in pregnancy)
- Ethambutol (not needed if sensitive to all TB medications)

After using RIPE for 2 months, continue rifampicin and isoniazid for another 4 months.

The following conditions require >6 months of therapy.
- Osteomyelitis
- Miliary TB
- Meningitis
- Pregnancy (when pyrazinamide is not used)
- Cavitary lesions
